alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 7:16PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 716 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of San Jon, or 30 miles east of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... San Jon, Glenrio, Broadview, Wheatland, Bellview, and Bard. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 343 and 373. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.
